In the event of a change in the applicable quality standards during the order, the contractor will adjust the fuel quality to the applicable standards. Fuel will be purchased by refueling the Ordering Party's vehicles and equipment at the Contractor's gas station located in the city of Tuchola. The subject of the order is the delivery and installation of a photovoltaic installation for the needs of Zabrzański AQUARIUS Recreation Complex at Aleja Wojciecha Korfantego 18 in Zabrze, implemented as part of the project: "Clean Zabrze - energy transformation of the city. Public utility - stage I" under the European Funds for Silesia Program 2021-2027. Project co-financed by the Fund Just Transition under the European Funds for Silesia Program 2021-2027, Priority FESL.10 "European Funds for Transformation", Measure FESL.10.06 "Development of distributed energy based on renewable energy sources". The order involves the implementation of a photovoltaic installation mounted on a carport type structure. The scope of the order includes: a) construction of carports with a photovoltaic installation, b) construction of an energy storage facility, c) land development. The photovoltaic installation will consist of: a) glass-glass photovoltaic modules mounted on the roof structure parking lots, b) photovoltaic inverters cooperating with photovoltaic modules, c) power optimizers on photovoltaic modules, d) direct current photovoltaic switchboards (RDC), e) alternating current photovoltaic switchgear (RPV), f) equipment of LV and MV switchgears of the facility for the installation photovoltaic and energy storage, g) direct current (DC) and alternating current (AC) cabling, h) integrated Energy Management System, i) energy storage, j) telemechanics system, k) energy measurement systems .... The source will work as part of the system, covering the heat demand for heating cells and domestic hot water. The estimated amount of energy will be 114,422.68 GJ/year, which will constitute 57.60% of the annual demand into thermal energy for the heating system.<br> Technological Variant No. 2: construction of new sources of heat energy technology mixed, which will consist of a high-efficiency cogeneration system powered by natural gas and renewable energy sources with a total thermal power of 6.2 4.5 MW. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: INDEPENDENT PUBLIC HEALTH CARE FACILITY. Summary: Successful Delivery of Fuels: Unleaded Petrol Pb 95 and Diesel Oil to Vehicles of Sp Zoz in Mogilno. Description: The subject of the order is the successive delivery of liquid fuels, unleaded gasoline Pb95 and diesel oil to the vehicles of the Independent Public Health Care Facility in Mogilno. Delivery will take place in a cashless sales system, in quantities according to the needs of the Ordering Party. Car list will be delivered after signing the contract. The Ordering Party expects to use 7 fuel cards. In the event of a failure of the distributors, the Contractor is obliged to provide emergency refueling. The Ordering Party requires that the Contractor has at least one gas station located no more than 10 km from the headquarters. SPZOZw Mogilno, ensuring the possibility of refueling (Pb 95, ON) from the pump 24 hours a day, including Sundays and holidays.. Published Date: 2025-11-03. Closing Date: 2025-11-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Successful Delivery of Fuels: Unleaded Petrol Pb 95 and Diesel Oil to Vehicles of Sp Zoz in Mogilno

Delivery will take place in a cashless sales system, in quantities according to the needs of the Ordering Party. Car list will be delivered after signing the contract. The Ordering Party expects to use 7 fuel cards. In the event of a failure of the distributors, the Contractor is obliged to provide emergency refueling. The Ordering Party requires that the Contractor has at least one gas station located no more than 10 km from the headquarters. SPZOZw Mogilno, ensuring the possibility of refueling (Pb 95, ON) from the pump 24 hours a day, including Sundays and holidays.

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: POLISH RADIO REGIONAL BROADCASTING STATION IN KIELCE "RADIO KIELCE" S.A. IN LIQUIDATION. Summary: Purchase of Electricity for the Needs of Radio Kielce S.A. in Liquidation for 2026 and Sale of Electricity Generated from a Renewable Energy Source. Description: The subject of the order for this procedure is the supply for the Polish Radio - Regionalna Rozgoń in Kielce Radio Kielce S.A. in liquidation (hereinafter Radio Kielce S.A. in liquidation) electricity and purchase of energy produced at the facility of Radio Kielce S.A. in liquidation. Subject of the order includes: 1) Daily, 24-hour supply of electricity to the Ordering Party's facility during the term of the contract in an estimated amount of approximately 702 kWh, including: - morning peak - approximately 150 kWh; - afternoon peak - approximately 90 kWh; - remaining hours of the day approximately 462 kWh.2) Sales by the Ordering Party on to the Contractor, energy generated in the Renewable Energy Source (hereinafter: RES) of the Ordering Party, not used for its own needs, introduced into the network of the Distribution System Operator (hereinafter: DSO). The expected amount of energy generated in 2025 from renewable energy sources is approximately 60 MWh and introduced into the DSO network is approximately 8 MWh. A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in Appendix No. 1 Description of the subject of the order to the SWZ and in Appendix No. 4 Important provisions to the contract, constituting an integral part of this SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-11-01. Closing Date: 2025-11-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: POLISH RADIO REGIONAL BROADCASTING STATION IN KIELCE "RADIO KIELCE" S.A. IN LIQUIDATION

Subject of the order includes: 1) Daily, 24-hour supply of electricity to the Ordering Party's facility during the term of the contract in an estimated amount of approximately 702 kWh, including: - morning peak - approximately 150 kWh; - afternoon peak - approximately 90 kWh; - remaining hours of the day approximately 462 kWh.2) Sales by the Ordering Party on to the Contractor, energy generated in the Renewable Energy Source (hereinafter: RES) of the Ordering Party, not used for its own needs, introduced into the network of the Distribution System Operator (hereinafter: DSO). The expected amount of energy generated in 2025 from renewable energy sources is approximately 60 MWh and introduced into the DSO network is approximately 8 MWh. Description: The subject of the investment is the reconstruction of a building serving cultural functions in Beyce, located at: ul. Tysiclecia 26, 24-200 Beyce. The facility called the Municipal Cultural Center is located on the plot with registration number 849 and part of the plot with registration number 848, geodetic area 0004 Beyce-Centrum. The building was erected in 1962 as a two-story building with a partial basement and has not undergone comprehensive modernization since then. The aim of the investment task is: a) to carry out construction works in the construction, sanitary, electrical and telecommunications sectors, covering the following rooms: - Underground floor: storage rooms and a cloakroom for staff. - Ground floor: office, social, hygienic and sanitary, utility and storage rooms, a stage with an audience where seats in the form of a fold-out tribune were designed. - First floor: social, hygienic and sanitary, library. The reconstruction has an impact on: improving the aesthetics, acoustics, multimedia and function of the rooms. b) Adapting the facility for disabled people, including: adaptation of toilets, installation of an elevator, replacement of doors, kt.... Published Date: 2025-10-29. Closing Date: 2025-11-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: EDUCATION AND UPBRINGING CENTER FOR VOLUNTEER LABOR CORPS IN PLESZEW. Summary: Comprehensive Supply of Gas Fuel for the Education and Upbringing Center of the Ohp in Pleszew for 2026. Description: 1. The subject of the order is a comprehensive supply of high-methane natural gas of group E - to consumption points located in the facilities of the OHP Education and Upbringing Center in Pleszew. The Ordering Party allows offering gas equivalent to the requirements specified in the PN-C-04750:2011 Natural Gas standard. By Equivalent means a gas whose physicochemical properties are not worse than the requirements specified in the above-mentioned standard, in particular in terms of calorific value, methane content, hydrogen sulfide and total sulfur content, nitrogen content, humidity, and the presence of mechanical impurities. If offered equivalent gas, the Contractor is obliged to demonstrate in the offer that the offered product meets equivalent requirements by: presenting appropriate documents (e.g. quality certificates, test reports), indicating the standards according to which the gas is produced/supplied, comparing the parameters of the offered gas with the requirements PN-C-04750:2011 standards. The Ordering Party reserves the right to assess the equivalence of the offered gas on the basis of the submitted documents. Failure to demonstrate equivalence will result in rejection of the offer. The scope of the order includes the supply of wood pellets in the expected quantity of approximately 73 tons. The supplied fuel pellets must meet the quality requirements specified in the PN-EN ISO 17225-2 standard and have a valid DIN PLUS or EN Plus quality certificate for the offered pellets (Appendix No. 6). The delivered pellets will be covered by at least a 6-month manufacturer's warranty. The delivered pellet must meet the following parameters: raw material: wood from coniferous or deciduous trees or a mixture thereof, without any admixtures another substance, such as adhesives or hardeners; calorific value not lower than 16.5Mj/kg; humidity not greater than 10.0%; maximum ash content: up to 0.7%; sulfur content not greater than 0.08%; density from 1.0 to 1.4 kg/dm3; length from 10 to 40mm, diameter from 6 mm-8mm.. The scope of the subject of the order includes the design, construction and commissioning of a photovoltaic installation with a capacity of up to 140 kW, along with connection to the power grid and obtaining the formal and legal documentation required applicable legal regulations, necessary to launch and operate the installation in question. The subject of the order also includes author's supervision during construction works.<br> 3. A detailed description of the subject of the order is attached as Annex No. 7 to the SWZ - Program Functional and utilitarian. The order is divided into a design part and an implementation part, and the terms of execution of the order are regulated in detail in Annex No. 8 to the SWZ - Draft provisions of the contract.<br> 4. Task co-financed under the program: European Funds for Silesia 2021-2027 Priority FESL.10 "European Funds for Transformation" Measure FESL.10.6 "Development of distributed energy based on renewable energy sources".<br> 5.
